TYPE MONOPI.ACOPHORA | 

Archinacella indianensis (Miller, 1891) \ 

See: Tryblidium indianenseWliWcr, 1891 ] 

\ 
 Archinacella patelliformis(Hall, 1847) j 

' 'Plastoplesiotype "; U C 1 023 5 \ 

S. Weller, 1903c, p. 174, pi. 12, figs. 1-2 

Middle Ordovician, Trenton Limestone. 

On a hill on the property of Mr. E. J. Hough, just back of the mill at 
 Jacksonburg, near Blairstown, Warren County, New Jersey. S. 
 Weller Locality 174A. New Jersey Collection. 

Remarks: Archinacella is a monoplacophoran (Knight and Yochelson, 

1960, p. I 81). The original of UC 10235 may beat NJSM I 

Archinacella richmondensis Ulrich in Ulrich and Scofieid, 1897 I 

See: Tryblidium indianenseMWkr, 1891 

Cyrtocerina madisonensis (Miller, 1892) j 

See: Tryblidium madisonenseM'xWcr, 1892 

Cyrtolites(Cyrtonella)plleoius(Hall, 1861) I 

i 

Referred specimen: UC 1 25 1 1 

Hall, 1879, pp. 125-126, pi. 26, fig. 25 \ 

Middle Devonian, Hamilton Group. 

At Hamilton and at Pratt's Falls in Madison County, New York. :, 

James Hall Collection. 

Remarks: Cyrioliies fCyrtonella) pileolus = Cyrionella mite/la (Hall, 
 1862), a monoplacophoran (Rollins ei al., 1971, p. 168). 

Cyrionella mitella (Hall, 1862)
